titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky vs. Peter Wilkins, Indictment
CWG8890

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives

body.p:
State of Kentucky
McCracken Equity & Criminal Court } January Term 1861
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Peter Wilkins

The Grand Jury of McCracken County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Peter Wilkins of the offence of Retailing spirituous liquors to be drunk at the place of sale

Committed as follows to wit the said Peter Wilkins on the 25th day of July 1860 in the county aforesaid and in an open space and near the Rail Road and at or near the spring in Doct. Rawleys Land in said County Did sell without lawful authority spiritous liquors which were then and there drunk on or adjacent to the premises where sold -- against the peace and dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky

R, S, Ratcliffe Commonwealths Attorney pro tem 1st Judicial District Equity & Crim-Â
Information by
G, W, Woolfolk
J Ensly
Joseph Campbell
A. D, Hall
T. R, Bell
inal Court
Upon which finding of the Jury the following judgement was rendered

Comlth of Ky. Plaintiff
against
Peter Wilkins Defendant

The parties appeared by their attorneys and the Deft. filed his plea of not guilty and therepupon the following Jurors, viz. L. D. Roberts Wm P. Allen Thos Moore G. W. Thompson J. B. Galbreth, J. H. Martin Saml Brance J. W. Cobbs & Y. J. Burchett, (the parties agree to submit the case to nine Jurors) and having heard the evidence returned the following verdict
"We of the Jury find the Deft. guilty as charged in the within indictment
It is therefore adjudged by the Court that the Deft, make his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of Twenty Dollars and also the cost of this prosecution and executive is awarded & c,

Copies
Attest B Small P M C C

McCracken Eq. Ct.
Commonwealth
vs } Retailing in open space
Peter Wilkins
$20 } Liquor
A True Bill
R. G. Woolfolk
Foreman
Filed 24th July 1860
In consideration of the good character & poverty of Wilkins one half the fine remitted

Send to Doct Duke
Issd June 20. 1863.
